content: work the cable chart be- sl2 to cn and hold on the back k2 k2 from cn k2 tween the orange markers 5 k4 sl2 to cn and hold in front k2 k2 from cn k4 on wrong side row purl between the edging stitches this includes the wrong side row of the chart separating the sleeves / body you ll now transfer the sleeve sts into two stitch let s continue holders or pieces of cotton yarn r9 k to m sm k2 sm m1r k to m m1l sm k2 r1 k to m sm k1 sl1 to holder rm sl 33 sts to sm m1r k to m m1l sm k2 sm m1r k to m m1l holder rm sl1 to holder rejoin yarn and k1 rm k sm k2 sm m1r k to m sm work chart sm k to to m rm k1 sl1 to another holder rm sl 33 sts to m m1l sm k2 sm k3 sl1 8 sts increased holder rm sl1 to holder rejoin yarn and k1 rm k to m sm work chart sm k to m rm k2 sm k3 r 10 k4 sm p to last marker sm k10 sl1 sl 108 sts remaining repeat row 9 and 10 eleven times your last ws r2 k4 sm p to last marker sm k10 sl1 row should be a row 6 of the chart the chart will have been repeated 4 times you should now have r3 k to m sm k to m sm work chart sm k to m 178 sts on the needles distributed as follows sm k3 sl1 © innershelter knitting 2017 www innershelter net/category/knitting sleeves appendix abbreviations you can work one sleeve at a time or both at the m1l and m1r increases bobble - bind off same time the instructions are for working one tapered sleeve you can also work it straight co - cast on with no decreases and / or add ribbed cuffs these left and right leaning increases look neat cn - cable needle in regular stockinette st you can use other in- place the sleeve sts on a circular needle or dpns creases if you wish dpns - double pointed needle s and join to work in the round m1l lift the strand between the two stitches on k - knit round 1 to 4 k to end the needles left and right from the front to the round 5 k1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 back knit into the back leg of the strand m1l - make one left repeat rounds 1-5 two more times m1r lift the strand between the two stitches on m1r - make one right 29 sts remaining the needles left and right from the back to the p - purl front knit into the front leg of the strand this round 26 to 36 k to end can be a bit hard if so with your right needle pm -
